adjective.description: Having a sharp, pungent taste or smell; not sweet.
examples: the raw berries have an intensely bitter flavor

adjective.description: (of people or their feelings or behavior) angry, hurt, or resentful because of one's bad experiences or a sense of unjust treatment.
examples: I don't feel jealous or bitter
synonyms: with a chip on one's shoulder

adjective.description: (often used for emphasis) painful or unpleasant to accept or contemplate.
examples: today's decision has come as a bitter blow

adjective.description: (of wind, cold, or weather) intensely cold.
examples: a bitter wind blowing from the east

noun.description: Beer that is strongly flavored with hops and has a bitter taste.
Liquor that is flavored with the sharp pungent taste of plant extracts and is used as an additive in cocktails or as a medicinal substance to promote appetite or digestion.

phrases: the workers would fight to the bitter end for safer conditions
The champions, as would be expected of them fought to the bitter end but were unable to pierce a strong Wicklow defence for the match saving goal.
Most of the capacity crowd stayed to the bitter end.
Members of his audience showed their appreciation in the time-honoured fashion with lots of arm waving and frantic dancing - right to the bitter end.
Did he not realise that the Irish fight to the bitter end?
origin: Old English biter, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German bitter, and probably to bite.
